p:
For vegetation purposes, the TOAR metrics that focus on the entire distribution are:
The seasonal (i.e., December–February, March–May, June–August, and September–November) percentiles (median, 5 th, 25 th, 75 th, 95 th, 98 th, and 99 th) of hourly average ozone. The units are ppb. Trends in each percentile by season can provide information on specific changes that occur within the ozone distribution. These changes influence the magnitude of the exposure and dose metrics.
